byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Rome, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul. Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and SEBNEM ARSU

abstract: Pope Francis calls mass slaughter of Armenians by Ottoman Turks during World War I first genocide of 20th century, prompting angry response from Turkey.
lead_paragraph: In speaking of the World War I-era slaughter of Armenians, the pontiff upset officials in Turkey, which has resisted the genocide designation, saying that a large number of Turks were also killed during that period.

headline.main: Pope Calls Killings of Armenians ‘Genocide,’ Provoking Turkish Anger
